message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.CY 

This paper discusses the state of art in computer virology and introduces a new concept of creating undetectable malware using blockchain technology. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Additionally, the paper also discusses techniques adopted by malicious software to avoid viral detection, which falls under the sub-category cs.SE (Software Engineering). The paper also mentions the deployment of malware in smart cities and modern architectures, which could be categorized under cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Finally, the paper discusses the use of blockchain technology in creating undetectable malware, which could be categorized under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
